CHAR

Zigzagging my way through life, I got too many interests and not enough time! Be it engineering, circus, gardening, or random animal facts... I got my fingers in all the pies!

Who?

Me! Char! I studied electrical engineering at UIUC and then managed to snag a big-kid job as an epitaxy engineer. A few years of that led me to a mental plateau and thus decided to make some real waves. I made the logical leap of moving to Chicago to train as a circus performer. There, I discovered my love of contortion.

While I love contortion and can't give it up, I felt I had left something behind when I dropped everything to join the circus. A certain puzzle-solving mindset. And so, I enrolled in Flatiron's Software Engineering course.

I now get to have a lovely balanace of mental and physical stimulation that keeps me on all my literal and metaphorical toes.

Technical Skills

  • Backend and Frontend experience
  • Familiarity with Ruby/Rails/React, JS
  • History with Python, MATLAB, Java
  • SQL, Excel

Projects

The following are some culminating projects done during my time with Flatiron as well as personal projects. The purpose was to showcase mastery and a solid understanding in certain topics.

Six Clicks

A wikirace style game that I've put on Heroku. Choose a starting and ending point and count the number pages it takes to get to the target page.
video demo | github

  • Create a React App
  • Use Redux
  • Understand stateless components
  • Make use of react-router and proper RESTful routing
  • Use Redux middleware, redux-thunk
  • Interact with a Rails API

Pummel

A simple Whack-a-mole game. Use the numpad to bop the baddies and game points.
video demo | github

  • Integrate JavaScript and Rails
  • Asynchronous interactions between the client and server using JSON
  • Understand object oriented programming in a JS applications
  • Use a Rails backend and understand associations

trivichar

Collaborative trivia app. Make and take trivia questions and organize them in rounds to make public for people to play. The Rails project is a great chance for you to show off everything youâ€™ve learned about Ruby on Rails, MVC architecture, data modeling and so much more!
video demo | github

  • Use the Ruby on Rails framework
  • Understand validations to defend against invalid data
  • Have user authentication
  • Understand nested resources with the appropriate RESTful syntax

flishflash

Sinatra Flashcard app
video demo | github

  • Build an MVC Sinatra application
  • Use Active Record
  • Multiple models and relationships
  • Must have user accounts - users must be able to sign up, sign in, and sign out. Validate user uniqueness
  • a user must have the ability to create, read, update and destroy their own resources
  • Ensure that users can edit and delete only their own resources - not resources created by other users
  • Validate user input so bad data cannot be persisted to the database

purkamyern

Pokemon Api to make a simple pseudo pokedex.
video demo | github

  • Build a CLI
  • Access Data from an external source
  • Use Ruby

circuschar

This was my thing! my circus page! I made it with a bootstrap template. I started working on it before really learning any javascript. Emphasize what I did do - like having the understand how the author wrote the code. What to change where, and how to make the little edits for things that weren't readily available.
